Authors: Ranti K.S., Tuapattinaya D., Chang C., Girsang A.S.
Title: Data warehouse for analysing music sales on a digital media store
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ranti, K.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tuapattinaya, D., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chang, C., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Girsang, A.S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, every company knows that when making a decision that has a potential in affecting their assets, an accurately processed report is necessary in order to support the reasoning behind their decision. Generating a report for stakeholders quickly and accurately is highly required in assisting them making a data-driven decision. By developing a data warehouse, it is possible for a company to do a data-driven decision making to appeal to their customer segments. This paper proposes a data warehouse model design to analyse the sales data contained in the database. The method that was implemented for this particular data warehouse development is the nine-step methodology designed by Kimball. The results are then presented in pdf form and an interactive dashboard. © 2020 IOP Publishing Ltd. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Decision making; Digital storage; Sales; Customer segments; Data driven decision; Data warehouse development; Model design; Data warehouses
References: Andersen, O., Thomsen, C., Torp, K., SimpleETL: ETL Processing by Simple Specifications (2018) 20th International Workshop on Design, Optimization, Languages and Analytical Processing of Big Data Co-located with 10th EDBT/ICDT Joint Conference International Workshop on Data Warehousing and OLAP.; Dedic, N., Stanier, C., (2016) An Evaluation of the Challenges of Multilingualism in Data Warehouse Development; Snijders, C., Matzat, U., Reips, U.D., " Big Data": Big gaps of knowledge in the field of internet science (2012) International Journal of Internet Science, 7, pp. 1-5; Kimball, R., Ross, M., (2011) The Data Warehouse Toolkit: The Complete Guide to Dimensional Modeling.; Kimball, R., Ross, M., Becker, B., Mundy, J., Thornthwaite, W., (2015) The Kimball Group Reader: Relentlessly Practical Tools for Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence Remastered Collection.; Breslin, M., Data warehousing battle of the giants (2004) Business Intelligence Journal, 7, pp. 6-20; Dehne, F.K.H.A., Kong, Q., Rau-Chaplin, A., Zaboli, H., Zhou, R., Scalable real-time OLAP on cloud architectures (2015) Journal of Parallel and Distributed Computing, 79-80, pp. 31-41; Bizarro, P., Madeira, H., (2002) International Conference on Data Warehousing and Knowledge Discovery, 2454, pp. 232-244; Maliappis, M.T., Kremmydas, D., An Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) Database for Agricultural Policy Data: A Greek Case Study (2015) HAICTA, pp. 214-225; Sidi, E., El Merouani, M., El Amin, A.A., Star Schema Advantages on Data Warehouse: Using Bitmap Index and Partitioned Fact Tables (2016) Star, 134; Bouman, R., Van Dongen, J., (2009) Pentaho Solutions: Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing with Pentaho and MySQL.; Ilacqua, C., Cronstrom, H., Richardson, J., (2015) Learning Qlik Sense®: The Official Guide.
